concise_definition: v. 似乎, 看起来, 好像

definitions.explanation_en: To appear to be or to have a particular quality or characteristic, based on observation or perception, even if not necessarily true or confirmed.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指根据观察或感知，显得具有某种性质或特征，即使该性质或特征未必真实或已被证实。
definitions.example_en: She seems tired after working all night.
definitions.example_cn: 她通宵工作后看起来很疲惫。

definitions.explanation_en: To give the impression of being a certain way, often used to express uncertainty or subjective judgment.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指给人以某种印象，常用于表达不确定性或主观判断。
definitions.example_en: It seems like a good idea, but we should check the details first.
definitions.example_cn: 这似乎是个好主意，但我们应该先核实细节。

definitions.explanation_en: To be perceived or understood in a particular way, especially when the reality differs from the appearance.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指被感知或理解为某种方式，尤其当现实与表象不一致时。
definitions.example_en: He seems friendly, but he's actually quite distant.
definitions.example_cn: 他看起来很友好，但实际上相当疏远。

comparison.analysis: “Appear” (出现/显得) 与 “seem” 非常接近，常可互换，但 “appear” 更强调外在的视觉或感官印象，常用于正式语境；而 “seem” 更侧重主观感受或心理判断，语气更口语化、更常用。
“Look” (看起来) 是最口语化的表达，通常仅指视觉上的印象，如颜色、形状、姿态等；而 “seem” 可用于更广泛的感知层面，包括行为、性格、意图等抽象特征，适用范围更广。
“Sound” (听起来) 专指通过听觉获得的印象，如声音、语气、言辞等；而 “seem” 是通用词，可涵盖视觉、听觉、逻辑推理等多种感知方式，不局限于感官输入。
